page.title: 06Farming Newton/Dunham area
page.content: The Trent Basin comsists of a variety of soils suitable for most types of farming and this area is no exception. Here can be found most arable crops and most types of livestock. Crops grown include wheat, oats, barley,oil seed rape. Sugar beet, potatoes and carrots. Livestock reared are most commonly beef cattle then sheep pigs and dairy cows. There is also a chicken farm at North Clifton. There are fifteen farms in all:five at Newton, three at North Clifton, three at Ragnall. two at Dunham and two at Fledborough. Of these five are arable two are livestock and the remaining eight are mixed. Newton situated on slightly higher ground is better drained and suited to sheep rearing whilst the cattle farms are generally on the lusher West Bank of the Trent.
